name: rape oil mill operation | rape meal | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/2401/documentation

Inventory refers to the production of 1 kg rape oil, respectively rape meal. The multioutput-process 'rape seeds, in oil mill' delivers the co-products 'rape oil, at oil mill' and 'rape meal, at oil mill'.



This process includes the transport of rape seeds to the mill, and the processing of the seeds to rape oil and rape meal. The oil extraction refers to the cold-press extraction technique. System boundary is at the oil mill.
category: C:Manufacturing/10:Manufacture of food products/104:Manufacture of vegetable and animal oils and fats/1040:Manufacture of vegetable and animal oils and fats

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data from 1998 to 2006, current technology in CH
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data from biodiesel producers in CH, industrial data
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Cold pressing of rape seeds in a standard oil press (based on the EcoEnergie Etoy biodiesel pilot plant, CH), Swiss context.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data from various biodiesel producers in CH, industrial data

exchanges.description: Calculated value based on literature values and expert opinion. See comments in the parametres' comment field.

Calculated based on literature (Schmidt, J.H., 2007, Life cycle assessment for rapeseed oil and palm oil; Omni Tech International, 2010, Life Cycle Impact of Soybean Production and Soy Industrial Products), (Vionnet, S., Quantis Water Database - Technical Report, 2012). The process starts when rapeseeds enter the oil plant. It includes the processes: raw material reception and storage, screening, pre-heating, rolling, conditioning, pressing, clarification, drying, solvent extraction, heating, centrifugation, drying, etc. It is assumed that 80% of water use is allocated to cooling water and 20% of water is allocated as process water. The evaporation rate for process water used is the same as in case of oil production from soybeans.

exchanges.description: Correction to close carbon balance of individual outputs

Calculated based on literature (Schmidt, J.H., 2007, Life cycle assessment for rapeseed oil and palm oil; Omni Tech International, 2010, Life Cycle Impact of Soybean Production and Soy Industrial Products), (Vionnet, S., Quantis Water Database - Technical Report, 2012). The process starts when rapeseeds enter the oil plant. It includes the processes: raw material reception and storage, screening, pre-heating, rolling, conditioning, pressing, clarification, drying, solvent extraction, heating, centrifugation, drying, etc. The process ends when refined rapeseed oil leaves the plant. It is assumed that 80% of water use is allocated to cooling water and 20% of water is allocated as process water. The evaporation rate for process water used is the same as in case of oil production from soybeans.
